      • addMeasuredVariable

        int addMeasuredVariable(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String unit)
        Add a row in the measured_variables table.
        Parameters:
        name - Measured variable name.
        unit - Measured variable unit.
        Returns:
        -1 if failure, otherwise ID of the newly created measured variable.

      • addTimeSeries

        int addTimeSeries(int measured_variable_id,
                  java.sql.Timestamp start_time,
                  java.sql.Timestamp end_time,
                  java.lang.Double period,
                  int min_quality,
                  int max_quality)
        Add a row in the time_series table.
        Parameters:
        measured_variable_id - Measured variable ID.
        start_time - Start time of the time series.
        end_time - End time of the time series.
        period - Period of the time series, expressed in seconds.
        min_quality - Minimum acceptable quality.
        max_quality - Maximum acceptable quality.
        Returns:
        -1 if failure, otherwise ID of the newly created time series.

      • addObservations

        int addObservations(java.io.File csv_file,
                    java.lang.String measured_variable_name,
                    java.lang.String measured_variable_unit,
                    java.lang.Double period)
        Add observations from a CSV file that contains exactly one time series with the following columns: timestamp, value, quality (in that order). - Automatically create or update a MeasuredVariable row (name and unit). - Automatically create a TimeSeries row with start_date, end_date, min_quality and max_quality derived from the CSV.
        Parameters:
        csv_file - CSV file with columns: timestamp, value, quality.
        measured_variable_name - Name of the measured variable.
        measured_variable_unit - Unit of the measured variable
        period - Period of the time series, expressed in seconds.
        Returns:
        0 if failure, 1 if success.

      • addObservations

        void addObservations(int time_series_id,
                     java.util.List<ObservationRow> rows)
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Add a list of observation rows for a given time series.
        Parameters:
        time_series_id - Time series ID.
        rows - List of observation rows.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs.

      • addConfiguration

        int addConfiguration(int time_series_id,
                     java.lang.String aggregation_type,
                     double interval,
                     java.lang.String aggregation_table)
        Add a row in the configurations table.
        Parameters:
        time_series_id - Time series ID
        aggregation_type - Type of aggregation.
        interval - Aggregation interval in seconds.
        aggregation_table - Aggregation table name.
        Returns:
        0 if failure, 1 if success, 2 if it already exists.

      • updateTimeSeriesTimeRange

        void updateTimeSeriesTimeRange(int time_series_id)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Update the time range (start_date and end_date) for a given time series.
        Parameters:
        time_series_id - Time series ID.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If a database error occurs.

      • getMeasuredVariableId

        int getMeasuredVariableId(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String unit)
        Retrieve the ID of a measured variable based on its name and unit.
        Parameters:
        name - Measured variable name.
        unit - Measured variable unit
        Returns:
        -1 if failure, otherwise ID of the measured variable.

      • getTimeSeriesId

        int getTimeSeriesId(int measured_variable_id,
                    java.sql.Timestamp start_time,
                    java.sql.Timestamp end_time,
                    java.lang.Double period,
                    int min_quality,
                    int max_quality)
        Retrieve the ID of a time series.
        Parameters:
        measured_variable_id - Measured variable ID.
        start_time - Start time of the time series.
        end_time - End time of the time series.
        period - Period of the time series, expressed in seconds.
        min_quality - Minimum acceptable quality.
        max_quality - Maximum acceptable quality.
        Returns:
        -1 if failure, otherwise ID of the time series.

      • deleteObservations

        int deleteObservations(int time_series_id)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Delete observations for a given time series ID.
        Parameters:
        time_series_id - ID of the time series.
        Returns:
        Number of deleted rows.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • deleteObservations

        int deleteObservations(int time_series_id,
                       java.time.OffsetDateTime start_time,
                       java.time.OffsetDateTime end_time)
        Delete observations for a given time series ID in the specified time range. - Automatically update time series start_date and end_date.
        Parameters:
        time_series_id - ID of the time series.
        start_time - Start time.
        end_time - End time.
        Returns:
        0 if failure, 1 if success.

      • deleteTimeSeries

        int deleteTimeSeries(int time_series_id)
        Delete a time series by its ID. - Automatically delete all associated observations. - Automatically delete aggregation tables and configuration rows.
        Parameters:
        time_series_id - Time series ID
        Returns:
        0 if failure, 1 if success.

      • deleteConfiguration

        int deleteConfiguration(int time_series_id,
                        java.lang.String aggregation_type)
        Delete a row in the configurations table. - Automatically drop the associated aggregation table if it exists.
        Parameters:
        time_series_id -
        aggregation_type -
        Returns:
        1 success, 0 failure
